intro: Pilosella trichodonta f. minor, commonly known as the lesser trichodonta, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head. It is characterized by its delicate appearance and is often found in temperate regions of Europe and western Asia. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
